TopicTitle: Which one looks nicer; new Mk1 cockpit or old one

Articles.Content: IMO it is better that there is no "keep both" option, as that is what almost everyone would pick. The existing options actually show which one people prefer.

There's no reason to NOT keep both cockpits as separate parts.

The existing Mk1 cockpit is just fine as-is, but the new one would be cool to have too.

Well If we want to be blunt about it...

The old one looks like a pile of krap I hope hugo was an unpaid intern and anyone who thinks otherwise needs their eyes checked and their pilots licence revoked there I said it...

Honestly pester squad for a new fighter cockpit all you want but for the love of kraken don't make them keep that old piece of trash.
passinglurker, aesthetics are a subjective topic, please don't insult the opinions of others so dismissively.

I also think that the new mk1 cockpit looks like it wants to be a 2-seater cockpit. I think a tweak as simple as changing the 3 panes of glass to all be a single pane would make it look more like a cockpit meant to house only one kerbal. I like to put a mk1 cockpit with a mk1 inline directly following that to make mk1 planes that seat 2 kerbals, and I'm afraid the new cockpits will look weird in that configuration.

I certainly agree that they should just keep both, aesthetically they serve completely different purposes. Having a private jet style craft is indeed the direction the game is going, but are we forgetting Jeb's shenanigans? The game wouldn't be the same without it's 'ace pilots'.

Same opinion as a few others. The question isn't just which looks better. It's what looks better for its purpose.

For a fighter cockpit, the old one works well.

For a supersonic cockpit, that could go to space, the new one works extremely well.

Purely in looks, textures, and models, the new one looks better.

I like the new one better. We'll be able to make some small shuttles that actually look the part. For instance, it resembles a Dreamchaser cockpit more than any other part in the game. Some people will miss it, but the inline cockpit always seemed a better option for fighters anyway.

passinglurker, aesthetics are a subjective topic, please don't insult the opinions of others so dismissively.
